figcaption.p: Dragon ticket winners are celebrated with monthly portraits

Frequent beach walks and exploration bring joy to students
Dragon ticket winners are celebrated with monthly portraits
Field trip to Sumeg village with Native leaders
Students visit and explore local parks and learn about native culture

div.div: Hello Trinidad Families, please use these resources to navigate our Distance Learning Program.
NEW Letter from Mrs. Cavanagh regarding extended school closure
School is currently closed until April 10. 2020, Letters from Mrs. Cavanagh over the past several weeks can be found here.
To find your Distance Learning Schedule please click on this link to find your teacher
To see our Technology Policy click here
Free breakfast/lunch/supper boxes for students are available at Trinidad 12-1 daily and attheselocations throughout the county
Please visit our COVID-19, Health and Safety Page for Resources and Information (letters from Mrs. Cavanagh, News Articles, Links to community Resources)

div.div: Trinidad Elementary School is nestled in the redwoods 30 minutes north of Eureka, the county seat of Humboldt County. The unique geographical features of Trinidad Head and Trinidad Harbor create one of the most beautiful and scenic places to live – the jewel of Humboldt County!
